page.title: 20Four Oaks Ecology.
page.content: Sutton Park, the northern part of which lies within our area, is a nature reserve of great importance both locally and in the West Midlands generally.It is administered by the Birmingham District Council which places much emphasis on its retention as an unspoilt natural habitat. Despite some attempts at encroachment the park is conserved and protected Although traversed by roads, car access is limited mainly to the peripheral roads. A local Friends of the Park Association keeps a watchful eye on the area. Some of the members reside in the district. Climate and weather are in the middle ranges of the unpredictable British climate, although very severe frosts can occur in extreme winter conditions. An interesting ecological development has been the appearance of the Urban Fox.
